relatedanime.anime: Musekinin Kanchou Tylor: Tokubetsu Hen - Hitoribocchi no Sensou

recommendations.recommendation: a light "Legend of galactic heroes"(or more genericaly a space opra if you like) parody
A great parody of 70`s-80`s space operas, yet with consistently high quality. Worth every minute.

Funny at hell from the beginning to the early end , very interesting characters & realistic emotion developments , promising comedic LoGH-style background , a little bit sweet harem - What more can you ask for ? Well IF ONLY they gave it a proper ending . The ending is just a serious WTF that ruined the whole series without solve ANYTHING at all .

Now that`s an enjoyable and relaxing ride of an anime, completely unlike the usual comedy crap. At last a worthy comedy-parody that can be seen without losing interest at all times, and from all tastes too. It truly shows elements of war, army and space operas in the most ridiculous ways ever seen. Funny and absurd as hell at times, and even serious with a decent plot later on, this is a great, funny and unique space opera work, that more people should definitely check out.
It`s a great anime series. Must see it.
One of the very few comedies I`ve ever really enjoyed. An awesome anime -- and a great comedy / parody. A true gem of the past ;)

anime.description: Seeking to find the most comfortable living possible, http://anidb.net/ch7034 [Justy Ueki Tylor] stumbles upon what he thinks is a dream career: delivering pension checks for the United Planets Space Force (whose logo looks suspiciously like a giant tomato). Through his sheer luck (which at times borders the unbelievable), he goes from utter layabout to hero in charge of the good ship Soyokaze... oh, wait, did we call it a good ship? The Soyokaze, to put it bluntly, is the disgrace of the UPSF, and a dumping ground for the dregs of the universe. Even so, Tylor remains undaunted... after all, why should he care? He`s only the captain, after all... Source: AnimeNfo

externalentity.identifier: 無責任艦長タイラー_(アニメ)

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: android
tag.description: An android is a robot or synthetic organism designed to look and act like a human.

tag.name: artificial intelligence
tag.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is the intelligence of machines and the branch of computer science that aims to create it. AI textbooks define the field as "the study and design of intelligent agents" where an intelligent agent is a system that perceives its environment and takes actions that maximize its chances of success. John McCarthy, who coined the term in 1956, defines it as "the science and engineering of making intelligent machines." The field was founded on the claim that a central property of humans, intelligence—the sapience of Homo sapiens—can be so precisely described that it can be simulated by a machine. This raises philosophical issues about the nature of the mind and the ethics of creating artificial beings, issues which have been addressed by myth, fiction and philosophy since antiquity. Artificial intelligence has been the subject of optimism, but has also suffered setbacks and, today, has become an essential part of the technology industry, providing the heavy lifting for many of the most difficult problems in computer science. AI research is highly technical and specialized, and deeply divided into subfields that often fail to communicate with each other. Subfields have grown up around particular institutions, the work of individual researchers, the solution of specific problems, longstanding differences of opinion about how AI should be done and the application of widely differing tools. The central problems of AI include such traits as reasoning, knowledge, planning, learning, communication, perception and the ability to move and manipulate objects. General intelligence (or "strong AI") is still among the field`s long term goals.

tag.name: carefree
tag.description: A [b]carefree[b] person is free of worries, cares or concerns. This does not necessarily imply that they have no responsibilities or are negligent towards them; they are simply able to live out their lives in tranquility regardless of what happens.

tag.name: alien
tag.description: This entity or creature was born on another world than the main characters.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: power suit
tag.description: Power Suits are similar to Piloted Robots which are controlled from inside the robot except that Power Suits tend to be more directly tied to how the character moves and they are usually not as big as Piloted Robots can be. They are still mechanical and shouldn`t be confused with plug suits.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: violent retribution for accidental infringement
tag.description: A comedy / slapstick element often found in Ecchi anime: The hilarity derives from spontaneous embarrassment, overreaction of the "victim" (girl), immediate retribution for a seemingly inappropriate act, and a sense of pity with the supposed "aggressor" (boy). Typically a boy will - through no fault of his own - stumble into a girl, thus invading her personal space. In the process the boy may e.g. pull down her skirt, grab the girl`s breasts, or accidentally kiss her. Any level-headed girl would see the accident just for what it is. Not so the girl with an overly developed sense of modesty, and a thing for violence. She - often a tsundere - will clobber the boy with excessive brutality.

tag.name: humanoid alien
tag.description: Humanoids are aliens, intelligent beings who do not originate from Earth, but have a striking similarity to humans or at least show the basic body layout, i.e. two arms and legs, head with two eyes and ears, one nose and mouth. Though the latter - head-related features - may vary. As "DearS" shows some aliens actually exhibit super-human beauty, or as in the case of "Onegai Teacher" they are genetically compatible to humans for some strange reason.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: alcohol
tag.description: Alcohol (or more scientifically, ethanol), is one of the world`s oldest psychoactive substances. It is traditionally found in the form of a beverage such as beer, wine, or liquor, although in some contexts it can be inhaled to produce similar or intoxication, and some people prefer another way of consuming beverage-form alcohol. Alcoholic beverages are many and varied, due to production methods (fermentation or distillation), source materials (grains, fruits, vegetables, other plants), added substances such as flavorings, and many more ways of defining different forms of alcoholic beverages. Alcoholic beverages are divided into three general classes: beers, wines, and spirits. They are legally consumed in most countries, and over 100 countries have laws regulating their production, sale, and consumption. In particular, such laws specify the minimum age at which a person may legally buy or drink them. This minimum age varies between 16 and 25 years, depending upon the country and the type of drink. Most nations set it at 18 years of age.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: open-ended
tag.description: The ending of this anime is left to the viewer`s imagination. There are no clear hints at a definite story outcome, several possibilities are presented without closure, or the story ends suddenly without explanation. There may also be room for a sequel.

tag.name: space is an ocean
tag.description: The difference between space and ocean is marginal. In fact the two are completely interchangeable. Spacecraft are usually called ships and space forces use naval ranks. Movement in space is two-dimensional. There is friction. And not to forget space pirates are roaming through the galaxy and just so often you will encounter space whales. Some titles take this even a step further by actually displaying the space as a sort of gigantic liquid mass.

tag.name: bridge bunnies
tag.description: A term and English nickname describing the attractive girls who manage the various functions aboard a ship`s/starship`s bridge area. Although it originated in reference to characters from Macross, it does not exist among Japanese fans.

tag.name: sociocultural evolution
tag.description: Describes how cultures and societies develop over time, based on both cultural evolution and social evolution. A post-apocalyptic or a Utopian setting would show very interesting changes in human behaviour, mental state, or simply daily life.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: organic spaceship
tag.description: The primary design of the spaceships in this anime seem to be organic in nature. This is quite rare in sci-fi, and hints at certain regenerative properties of these ships, i.e. damage can automatically be repaired. Or that the ships need not be "built", but can be "grown". It might even imply a consciousness on the part of the spaceship. Typically spaceships are made of "dead" inorganic materials, though.

tag.name: faster-than-light travel
tag.description: Faster-than-light travel is taken for grated in this anime. This is achieved by travelling via hyperspace, nullspace, or wormholes.

tag.name: space opera
tag.description: Space opera is a sub-genre of fiction that emphasizes romantic adventures in space. Space opera generally involves large-scale conflicts between opponents with powerful abilities and technology. The genre will often be melodramatic, sometimes playing music that can be nothing short of awesome. Warfare and a battle of wits are usually less emphasized, preferring romance (with exceptions, e.g. Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu). Some space operas tend to be formulaic and sometimes even prosaic, often employing very simple devices and somewhat obvious strategies. An example of this would be the infamous laws of physics in the Macross universe, in which the main male lead will hardly ever get hit in battle.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ending
tag.description: This is a container tag to house meta-like tags relating to how endings of anime play out.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Azalyn D`el Kran Rykun
character.description: The 16-year-old empress of the Holy Raalgon Empire. Azalyn is a child, forced into the unenviable situation of having to assume power of the empire once her parents are murdered. Prompted by her advisors, she gives the command to attack the UPSF (assuming that they were behind the assassination plot). Having not had a chance to be a child, Azalyn must now be strong for the entire empire, and it`s a task that she is afraid of taking, but even more afraid of failing.

character.name: Yuriko Star
character.description: Lt. Commander Yuriko Star is another by-the-book officer. Yuriko joined the UPSF to give her life structure and attepts to obey the rules in almost every situation. However, she, unlike http://anidb.net/ch7036 [Yamamoto], has no problem telling http://anidb.net/ch7034 [Tylor] that he has done something wrong and will even resort to slapping him when he gets too far out of line. Yuriko also tries to downplay her gender, making herself a soldier first, and then a woman. This is a sore subject for her when someone comments about Tylor`s obvious attraction to her looks, pointing out that she has never used her appearance to get ahead; an equally sore point for her is her budding attraction to him. Yuriko is one of the most rational and level-headed officers on the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]. While she is senior to Yamamoto, her speciality as an intelligence officer places her outside the chain of command.

character.name: Justy Ueki Tylor
character.description: Justy Ueki Tylor joins the United Planets Space Force hoping for an easy ride through life but with the devil`s luck becomes a hero. He is soon promoted Lieutenant Commander and Captain of http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]. Tylor is a irresponsible laid back captain that can always find his way out of trouble unscathed. Tylor normally allows his crew to "bend" the rules such as letting the surgeon drink while on duty. Throughout the ranks it is argued that Tylor is either the most brilliant military mind or just a lucky bafoon.

character.name: Kyon-Hwa Kim
character.description: Kim works on the bridge as the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]`s communications officer. It is rumored that Kim was a fashion model prior to joining the military. She still enjoys dressing up and her urges to break out of the strict UPSF dress code cause problems between her and http://anidb.net/ch7033 [Yuriko Star]. Her hobbies include shopping and modern dance. She likes to read a women`s magazine called "Enen" in her free time, but is absolutely professional where her job is concerned. She is cool-headed in a crisis and extremely skilled as a communications officer. She says at one point that she transfered onto the Soyokaze in order to find direction in her life, and there`s the strong possibility she did it after breaking up with a man.

character.name: Makoto Yamamoto
character.description: Lieutenant Makoto Yamamoto is another very strait-laced, by-the-books military man. Yamamoto is the first officer on the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze] and tried mightily to interject an air of professionalism to the outfit. Constantly enraged by http://anidb.net/ch7034 [Tylor]`s lack of discipline and his loose command of the troops, Yamamoto spends much of his free time in the medic`s office taking tranquilizers and making use of the neuro-cleanser. Yamamoto sees Tylor for what he is, a bumbling fool, but is torn between the unwritten soldier`s code of supporting and obeying your superior officer, and telling the UPSF brass what is REALLY going on. He is always on the lookout for a chance to get some form of command, hoping to get a ship of his own one day.

character.name: Hidezaburo Kitaguchi
character.description: Dr. Kitaguchi maintains the understaffed and under-stocked sick bay of the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]. A great lover of alcohol in all its form, he even uses it to anesthetize and sterilize his patients. While only 33 years old, Kitaguchi claims to have a 30-year drinking habit and proclaims that he performs better in surgery when he`s liquored up. With the arrival of http://anidb.net/ch7039 [Harumi], he becomes the envy of the entire male crew. He and http://anidb.net/ch7034 [Tylor] are drinking buddies, and he is one of the few crew members to gain a deep understanding of Tylor`s true nature early on. He claims the reason he became a doctor was because "it`s better than being a patient."

character.name: Harold Katori
character.description: Katori is the spiritual pilot/navigator the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]. A great lover of Japanese green tea - if he has a cup, he can be counted on to perform the most difficult maneuvers (like steering through an asteroid belt) without breaking a sweat. While he appears to be a Westerner, he is actually of Japanese descent. Possessed of a self-confidence that borders on arrogance, he claims that the ship is as "safe as a cradle" when he`s at the helm. His hobbies include various types of meditation, including Zen meditation.

character.name: Harumi Nakagawa
character.description: Assigned to the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze] as the http://anidb.net/ch7037 [Doctor]`s assistant, Harumi has every man on the ship falling all over her - especially the Marines. But she`s only after one man: http://anidb.net/ch7034 [Tylor]! Unknow to most of the crew, Harumi is actually an android Raalgon spy. She was sent to the UPSF by http://anidb.net/ch7044 [Ru Baraba Dom] and http://anidb.net/ch38778 [Shia Has] to kill Tylor. Instead, she succumbs to Tylor`s charm and ends up falling in love with him!

character.name: Yumi Hanner
character.description: The remarkable http://anidb.net/ch7041 [Emi] and Yumi Hanner are young girls who first meet http://anidb.net/ch7033 [Tylor] while they are taking care of their father, Admiral http://anidb.net/ch38780 [Robert J. Hanner] (retired). After they are taken hostage, Emi and Yumi are rescued by Tylor and fall in love with him. They join the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]`s crew when Tylor is reassigned as its captain. Desired to pilot ships, they persuade http://anidb.net/ch7042 [Kojirou] to train them (against his will of course) and discover that they have a natural piloting ability. Emi and Yumi`s close quarters with Kojirou provide them with endless amusement since he is deathly afraid of females. Identical twins, the only way to tell them apart is by their pony tails (Yumi`s is on the left side of her head, while Emi`s is on her right) and their voices (Yumi`s is higher pitched than Emi`s). They were also childhood friends of http://anidb.net/ch7033 [Yuriko Star].

character.name: Emi Hanner
character.description: The remarkable Emi and http://anidb.net/ch7040 [Yumi] Hanner are young girls who first meet http://anidb.net/ch7033 [Tylor] while they are taking care of their father, Admiral http://anidb.net/ch38780 [Robert J. Hanner] (retired). After they are taken hostage, Emi and Yumi are rescued by Tylor and fall in love with him. They join the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]`s crew when Tylor is reassigned as its captain. Desired to pilot ships, they persuade http://anidb.net/ch7042 [Kojirou] to train them (against his will of course) and discover that they have a natural piloting ability. Emi and Yumi`s close quarters with Kojirou provide them with endless amusement since he is deathly afraid of females. Identical twins, the only way to tell them apart is by their pony tails (Yumi`s is on the left side of her head, while Emi`s is on her right) and their voices (Yumi`s is higher pitched than Emi`s). They were also childhood friends of http://anidb.net/ch7033 [Yuriko Star].

character.name: Kojirou Sakai
character.description: The supremely self-confident pilot of the Ranpu-class fighter assigned to the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]. Known alternately as "The Samurai of Space" and "The Shoot-Down King," Kojirou graduated with honors from flight training. While he hasn`t logged that many hours of flight time, he shows deadly skill against the Raalgon forces. Possessing an actual phobia of women, he seems to regard the Hanner sisters as a special case, no doubt owing to their own natural piloting skill. He keeps a small mascot doll the twins made for him in the cockpit of his fighter. He also gets along very poorly with the Marines.

character.name: Karl Bjorn Andresen
character.description: Andressen is the pilot of the Dropship, the troop transport which carries the Marines into combat. Nicknamed "Eric the Red," he seems to be the most mature person aboard the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze].

character.name: Ru Baraba Dom
character.description: Ru Baraba Dom is the commander of the Raalgon cruiser Doroume, 66th Detached Fleet. As the war progresses, http://anidb.net/ch7032 [Azalyn] comes to trust his intelligent advice. Unlike many of his fellow colleagues, Dom respects and admires http://anidb.net/ch7034 [Tylor] for his fighting and tactical abilities. Both Tylor and Dom recognize that wars can only be won when no one fights. He is loyal to the young empress and stands firmly in Lonawer`s camp to find a way to end the war honorably and with a minimum of bloodshed.

character.name: Naku Ra Wang
character.description: Chief Advisor to the Holy Raalgon Empress, Wang craves to be more than just the Premier. He places the blame of the Emperor`s death on the UPSF and craftily convinces Empress http://anidb.net/ch7032 [Azalyn] to declare war with them. Meanwhile, Wang continues to manipulate the Empire`s opinion against the Empress to force her to bend to his will. Hungry for the power of the throne, he makes several attempts on Azalyn`s life.

character.name: Mickey Cryburn
character.description: Cryburn is the commander of the Marine contingent on board. His Hammer combat suit is painted pink and he seems to be best friends with http://anidb.net/ch7043 [Andressen].

character.name: Soyokaze
character.description: While its design is old, this destroyer is a hardy veteran of many battles. It`s equipped with long-range laser cannons and photon torpedos as well as phaser banks for point defense.

character.name: Yutta Do Lonawer
character.description: The Imperial Minister of Defense, he directly commands the 27th galactic frontier division. http://anidb.net/ch7044 [Dom]`s direct superior, he has shepherded the young captain through the Imperial Forces and acts as a father figure for him. While strongly suspicious of http://anidb.net/ch7050 [Wang]`s motives for starting the war with the United Planets, he lacks the political strenght to directly oppose him. Fiercely loyal to the empress, he does all he can to protect her from the machinations of her ambitious prime minister. However, this patriotism will not let him directly question the war in public, putting him in a very tenuous position within the Imperial Court.

character.name: Rakuram Do Donan
character.description: Admiral Donan is the commander of the 23rd galactic frontier division, led from his command ship, the battleship Baroume. A large man with an equally large appetite, he can usually be seen eating with both hands at once while sitting in his command chair. Called a "disgusting man" by http://anidb.net/ch7044 [Dom], Donan`s battle tactics are as crude as his table manners.

character.name: Shia Has
character.description: Captain of the large destroyer Galguran, Shia Has carries approximately the same rank as http://anidb.net/ch7044 [Ru Baraba Dom], but is under his direct command as part of his fleet. She is more aggressive and forceful than Dom. She is harshly critical of the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze]`s crew and falls to see http://anidb.net/ch7034 [Tylor] in the same light as Dom.

character.name: Robert J. Hanner
character.description: A great leader in his day, Admiral Hanner is now retired. At the beginning of the series, he is under the care of his two daughters, http://anidb.net/ch7041 [Emi] and http://anidb.net/ch7040 [Yumi] Hanner. His first encounter with http://anidb.net/ch7034 [Tylor] is when he and his two daughters are rescued from a hostage situation. After Emi and Yumi are assigned to the http://anidb.net/ch7063 [Soyokaze], Adm. Hanner moves to a new home, but is visited by Tylor and his daughters from time to time. Hanner`s exploits on the galactic frontier have earned him respect even among the Raalgon.

episode.title: パコパコ ジュニア!
Paco-Paco Junior
Pako pako junior
Pako Pako Junior
Paco Paco Junior!
宇宙で一番長い日
The Longest Day in Space
Le jour le plus long
Il giorno più lungo della galassia
Uchuu de Ichiban Nagai Hi
プッツン プッツン ピチパチ プッツン
Snap! Snap! Crackle! Snap!
La mort de l`Amiral
Morte di un ammiraglio
Puttsun Puttsun Pichipachi Puttsun
マイウェイが切なくて
